rename.from: TestResult exit code seemingly not passed to BEP
rename.to: TestResult exit code seemingly not surfaced in BEP

issue.title: Respect XDG directory settings on macOS

labels.name: P3
labels.description: We're not considering working on this, but happy to review a PR. (No assignee)

labels.name: team-OSS
labels.description: Issues for the Bazel OSS team: installation, release processBazel packaging, website

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Someone outside the Bazel team could own this

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
### Description of the feature request:


Per #16937, while the XDG Base Directory spec is more commonly adopted on Linux, there's little I'm aware of in the way of supporting it on macOS for those users who set the environment variables. Is this something that can be added as a secondary option for that platform, or is there something special about `/private/var/tmp` as an output root? 

### Which category does this issue belong to?

Core

### What underlying problem are you trying to solve with this feature?


A similar issue as interrogated with #16937, but for macOS instead of just Linux.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


macOS 15.3

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.0.1

issue.body:
Fixes #25165

I hope I did this right. I am able to see the output in my repro on rules_apple (which I can share if required by code review). Let me know if there's anything I've overlooked!

It would be great to get this into 8.1.0 if possible.

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 8.2.0 RC3](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.2.0rc3). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.2.0rc3. Thanks!
